intro: Homalobus hylophilus, commonly known as the white-leafed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a distinctive white or pale green coloration. The flowers are usually pink to red in color and bloom during the rainy season.
